intro: Oreothyrsus, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring erect stems and showy, often fragrant flowers. These plants are typically found in rocky or mountainous regions, where they thrive in well-drained soils. Oreothyrsus species are known for their ability to adapt to harsh environments, often growing in full sun. Their botanical significance lies in their ecological role and their value in horticultural collections.
